item.title: Absolum physical editions announced for PS5, Switch
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/absolum-physical-editions-announced-for-ps5-switch

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Due out alongside digital release later in 2025.

Silver Lining Interactive, in cooperation with publisher Dotemu and developers Guard Crush Games and Supamonks, will release physical standard and Signature editions of arcade-like beat ’em up game Absolum for PlayStation 5 and Switch alongside the digital edition when it launches later in 2025, the distributor announced.

The standard edition will include the full game and digital soundtrack.

The Signature Edition, available via Silver Lining Direct, includes the following content:

  • Four Exclusive Metal Pins – Featuring designs of Absolum‘s unforgettable characters.
  • Full-Color Art Booklet – Packed with stunning illustrations and concept art straight from the developers.
  • Poster-Quality Artwork – A bold, high-quality print that brings Absolum‘s world to life.
  • Four Character Trading Cards – Spotlighting the key characters from the game’s world.
  • Collector’s Box – A specially designed Signature Edition collector’s box.

Absolum is due out for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam in 2025.

Watch a new trailer below.

Special Edition Announce Trailer

item.title: Atomfall story expansion DLC ‘Wicked Isle’ launches June 3
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/atomfall-story-expansion-dlc-wicked-isle-launches-june-3

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Dare you visit the dark and lonely waters of the Wicked Isle?

Survival action game Atomfall story expansion downloadable content “Wicked Isle” will launch on June 3 for $19.99, developer Rebellion Developments announced. It will add a new location, new characters, new enemies, and additional leads, weapons, skills, and items, along with multiple new endings for the main game.

Here is an overview of the expansion, via Rebellion Developments:

Drawing on the folk horror elements of the game for inspiration, the story expansion is set on Midsummer Island. To cross to the island players must talk to the boat-keeper who can be found on the jetty in Wyndham Village. He will give you information about the island as well as your first Lead.

“Midsummer is located close to the Windscale Atom Plant and as a result the levels of infection in both the people and environment are higher than on the mainland,” explained Rebellion Developments head of design Ben Fisher. “You are going to meet new enemy factions including pirate bandits and infected druids. To help you survive there are new weapons to be found on the island including a devastating Blunderbuss shotgun, a new bow, cutlass, daggers and the Beekeeper’s Staff. You will also be able to acquire new skills which will aid you on your quest as well as an upgraded metal detector which will enable you find even more loot caches.”

The Leads you uncover in “Wicked Isle” will open a variety of story treads, some of which create new potential endings for the main Atomfall game.

Included in the Deluxe Edition and in the Deluxe Upgrade Pack, and available to purchase separately when released ($19.99), “Wicked Isle” will be available June 3. Game Pass subscribers will benefit from a 10 percent discount.

Atomfall is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and Microsoft Store. It is also available via Game Pass.

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

DLC “Wicked Island” Trailer

Screenshots

  • ❮
  • ❯

item.title: Hunter x Hunter: Nen x Impact demo launches May 30 for PC, later for PS5
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/hunter-x-hunter-nen-x-impact-demo-launches-may-30-for-pc-later-for-ps5

  • PC
  • PS5

Six characters, plus Battle and Training modes.

Publisher Bushiroad Games and developer Eighting will release a demo for fighting game Hunter x Hunter: Nen x Impact on May 30 at 10:00 JST for PC via Steam and at a later date for PlayStation 5, the companies announced.

As previously announced, the demo will feature playable characters Gon, Killua, Leorio, Kurapika, Hisoka, and Netero, as well as access to both Battle and Training modes.

Hunter x Hunter: Nen x Impact is due out for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC via Steam on July 17.
